reporting-org.narrative: Norad - Norwegian Agency for Development Cooperation

description.narrative:
Since the start of the crisis, the Agency has worked diligently to deliver essential lifesaving services to Palestine refugees throughout the Middle East. Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) has been distributed to thousands of front line health staff, triage systems have been introduced in all health centres to screen patients with respiratory symptoms and minimize contact with other patients, non-critical health services have been suspended, and telemedicine and door-to-door delivery of medicine and food were introduced to reduce foot traffic at health clinics and food distribution centres. The direct target group of the project Palestine Refugees in the West Bank and Gaza, residents of refugee camps, health staff and school children. The planned intervention aims to support UNRWA to fulfil its needs to hire additional health staff, including medical officers, practical nurses, pharmacists, midwives, lab technicians and cleaners for a period ranging from 1-3 months in order to contain COVID-19 situation in the West Bank and Gaza.
- Approx. 178 surge health staff hired to support UNRWA’s Covid-19 response. - UNRWA schools are provided with needed cleaning and disinfection materials & tools - A staff rotation system is in place in all 43 health centers in the West Bank as part of COVID-19 response. - UNRWA students receive equitable, quality and inclusive education services while standards of physical distancing are enforced. - Refugee camps benefit from improved access to sanitation services and infection control measures.
